panels.title: Requests/s
panels.description: Average HTTP requests per second over the selected time range. Should be > 0 if service is receiving traffic.

panels.title: Latency P95
panels.description: 95th percentile of HTTP request latency over the selected time range. Values > 1s indicate performance issues.

panels.title: Errors/s
panels.description: Application errors per second. Should be 0 or very low in healthy system.

panels.title: Uptime
panels.description: Service availability. 1 = up, 0 = down. All instances should be up.

panels.title: Request Breakdown
panels.description: HTTP requests per second broken down by route. Shows which endpoints are being used most.

panels.title: Total Cache Size
panels.description: Total number of cached price entries. Should be > 0 if cache is working.

targets.expr: sum(increase(cache_hits_total{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", source=~"$source"}[$__range])) / clamp_min(sum(increase(cache_hits_total{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", source=~"$source"}[$__range]) + increase(cache_misses_total{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", source=~"$source"}[$__range])), 0.00001)

panels.title: Hit Ratio
panels.description: Cache hit ratio over the entire selected time range. Higher is better. >95% is excellent, <80% indicates cache issues.

panels.title: Tracked Pairs
panels.description: Number of trading pairs currently being tracked and cached.

panels.title: Unique Pairs
panels.description: Total unique trading pairs configured in the system.

panels.title: Cache Hits vs Misses
panels.description: Cache hits vs misses per source. More hits = better performance. High misses indicate cache problems.

panels.title: Cache Size Trend
panels.description: Number of cached entries over time by source. Should grow initially then stabilize.

panels.title: Max Staleness
panels.description: Maximum time since last successful price update. >300s indicates stale data.

panels.title: WS Connections
panels.description: Active WebSocket connections to price sources. Should be > 0 for real-time updates.

panels.title: WS Messages/s
panels.description: WebSocket messages received per second. Indicates real-time data flow.

panels.title: Quotes Processed/s
panels.description: Successfully processed price quotes per second. Should be > 0 for active trading pairs.

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.95, sum(rate(price_update_frequency_seconds_bucket{job="$job", instance=~"$instance", source=~"$source", pair=~"$pair"}[1m])) by (le, source))

panels.title: Update Frequency P95
panels.description: 95th percentile of price update intervals by source. Lower is better for real-time data.

panels.title: Staleness Trend
panels.description: Average staleness of price data by source. Should be low and stable.

panels.title: Staleness by Pair
panels.description: Staleness of each trading pair by source. Green <10s, Yellow 10-60s, Red >60s.

panels.title: API Errors
panels.description: API errors per second by source. Should be 0 or very low. High values indicate source problems.

panels.title: Rate Limit Hits
panels.description: Rate limit hits per second by source. High values may cause data staleness.

panels.title: Fetch Latency P95
panels.description: 95th percentile of API fetch latency by source. High values may indicate network or source issues.

panels.title: Price Not Found
panels.description: Rate of price not found errors by source. May indicate missing trading pairs on source.

panels.title: CPU Usage
panels.description: CPU usage percentage. High sustained values may indicate performance bottlenecks.

panels.title: Memory Usage
panels.description: Resident memory usage. Steady growth may indicate memory leaks.

panels.title: Event Loop Lag P99
panels.description: 99th percentile of event loop lag. High values indicate blocking operations affecting responsiveness.

panels.title: GC Duration P95
panels.description: 95th percentile of garbage collection duration. Long GC pauses can affect performance.
